newsitem.title: USA: Group Technologies says part of merger plan.
newsitem.headline: Group Technologies says part of merger plan.

text.p: Group Technologies Corp said Thursday its majority holder, Group Financial Partners Inc, plans to acquire the company.

Group Financial Partners is a private holding company based in Louisville, Ky., which originally acquired Group Technologies in 1989 and currently owns about 80 percent of the company's outstanding shares.
The proposed merger is part of a plan under which Group Financial would combine several companies in which it owns the controlling interest into a new publicly held firm.
The other companies to be merged into the new entity are Bell Technologies Inc and Tube Turns Technologies Inc, each of which is a subsidiary of Group Financial, the company said.
Terms of the proposed merger remain subject to negotiation. The company said it hopes to close the merger in the first quarter of 1997.
The plan is to effect the merger through a tax-free exchange of shares in the new corporation, the company said.
The new firm would be focused primarily on providing specialty electronic manufacturing services and products.
